privacy_policy_settings.offers_a_variety: offers a variety of team productivity, collaboration, and organizational tools available online, including via a mobile application (collectively, the “Service”), and websites, including but not limited to
privacy_policy_settings.the_websites: (the “Websites”). As you use the Service and interact with the Websites,
privacy_policy_settings.collects_and_processes: collects and processes information from and about you in order to provide you with access to the Service, enhance your experience while using the Service, and interact with you. This Privacy Policy (the “Policy”) describes how
privacy_policy_settings.collects_uses: collects, uses, and discloses information collected through the Service and Websites, and what choices you have with respect to such information. The first section below explains which privacy terms are applicable to you depending on what type of user you are.
privacy_policy_settings.entity_that_acts_as: entity that acts as the data controller or data processor of your information, as explained in more detail below. If you do not agree with this Policy, do not access or use the Service, Websites, or any other part of
privacy_policy_settings.if_you_have_any: If you have any questions about this Privacy Policy, please contact
privacy_policy_settings.privacy_policy_contains: This Privacy Policy contains the following sections:
privacy_policy_settings.what_type_of_user_what: What Type of User am I and What Privacy Terms
privacy_policy_settings.list_item_4: Additional Privacy Terms for All Users
privacy_policy_settings.what_type_of_user_which: What Type of User am I and Which Privacy Terms Are Applicable to Me?
privacy_policy_settings.has_three_different: has three different types of users depending on the
privacy_policy_settings.products_used_please: products used. Please see the bullets below to determine which type of user you are, and then click the internal link to visit the privacy terms applicable to you. It is possible that you may use
privacy_policy_settings.in_different_ways: in different ways. If so, please review all applicable privacy terms. Also, don’t forget to review Section V, which contains privacy terms applicable to all users.
privacy_policy_settings.subscribers: Subscribers. We call users who use the Service as part of any tier of a paid
privacy_policy_settings.subscription_plan: subscription plan “Subscribers.” The Service features and functionalities available to Subscribers are determined by the specific terms agreed to between
privacy_policy_settings.and_the_organization: and the organization (e.g., your employer or another entity or person, called the “Customer”) that entered into a separate agreement that governs delivery, access, and use of the Service (for purpose of this Policy, the “Customer Agreement”). The Customer controls its instance of the Service and is the data controller of the information collected through the Service about Subscribers, and
privacy_policy_settings.is_a_data_processor: is a data processor of such information.
privacy_policy_settings.free_users: Free Users. We call users who use a non-paid version of the Service “Free Users.” While Free Users can access and use the Service, they have access to a more limited set of Service features and functionality than Subscribers.
privacy_policy_settings.is_the_data_controller_free: is the data controller of the information collected through the Service about Free Users.
privacy_policy_settings.site_visitors: Site Visitors. We call users of the Websites “Site Visitors.” Site Visitors can be individuals who are simply browsing the Websites but who do not use the
privacy_policy_settings.service_workhall: Service; or, Site Visitors can be Free Users or Subscribers who visit the Websites to seek additional information about
privacy_policy_settings.is_the_data_controller_site: is the data controller of the information collected through the Website about Site Visitors.
privacy_policy_settings.section_of_this_policy: Section II of this Policy applies only to Subscribers. If you are a Subscriber, the “Customer Agreement” governs the collection and processing of information collected from you through the Customer's instance of the Service (e.g. a Customer's organization or workspace, but for purposes of this Policy referred to as the “Workspace”), including all associated messages, attachments, files, tasks, projects and project names, team names, channels, conversations, and other content submitted through the Service (“Workspace Content”). In the event of a conflict between this Privacy Policy and the Customer Agreement, the Customer Agreement governs. Because the Customer controls the Workspace used by Subscribers, if you have any questions about the Customer's specific Workspace settings and privacy practices, please contact the Customer whose Workspace you use. If you are a Subscriber located in the European Union, please note that the Customer is the data controller with respect to the processing of your Workspace Content pursuant to the EU General Data Protection Regulation (“GDPR”). When processing Workspace Content of EU data subjects governed by the Customer Agreement,
privacy_policy_settings.is_the_data_processor_customer: is the data processor, meaning that we collect and process such information solely on behalf of the Customer.
privacy_policy_settings.collection_and_use: Collection and Use of Subscriber Information
privacy_policy_settings.information_from_subscribers: This section explains the information we collect from Subscribers. We do not require Subscribers to provide us with information. However, certain information, such as account log-in data, is required to provide you with access to the Service, and other information may be collected automatically as you use the Service.
privacy_policy_settings.workspace_content: Workspace Content. Workspace Content is collected, used, and shared by
privacy_policy_settings.in_accordance_with: in accordance with the Customer’s instructions, including any applicable terms in the Customer Agreement, or as required by applicable law. The Customer, and not
privacy_policy_settings.determines_its_own: , determines its own, internal policies regarding storage, access, modification, deletion, sharing, and retention of Workspace Content which may apply to your use of the Service. For example, a Customer may provide or remove access to the Service, enable or disable third-party integrations, manage permissions, retention and export settings, transfer or assign teams, or share projects. Please check with the Customer about the policies and settings that they have instituted with respect to the Workspace Content that you provide when using the Service.
privacy_policy_settings.account_information: Account Information. To set up your
privacy_policy_settings.account_content: account, you or the Customer will provide us with basic information about you which may include your name, address, telephone number, email address, and password. You will then have the ability to provide optional profile information, such as a photograph or basic demographic data. With your permission, we may also upload calendar information stored on your mobile device to your account. If you submit payment information in connection with your use of the Service, we utilize a third party credit card payment processing company to collect payment information, including your credit card number, billing address, and phone number. In such circumstances, the third party service provider, and not
privacy_policy_settings.stores_your_payment: , stores your payment information on our behalf.
privacy_policy_settings.service_usage_information: Service Usage Information. As you use the Service, we collect information about how you use and interact with the Service (“Service Usage Information”). Such information includes:
privacy_policy_settings.device_information: Device information – when you access the Service using a mobile device, we collect certain device information, including the type of device you are using, its operating system, and mobile network information, which may include your mobile phone number. We may also collect your MAC address and other unique device identifiers.
privacy_policy_settings.log_files_content: Log files – when you use the Service, our servers automatically record information in server log files. These log files may include information such as your web request, IP address, browser type and settings, referring/exit pages and URLs, number of clicks, date and time stamp information, language preferences, data from cookies and similar technologies, and other such information.
privacy_policy_settings.location_information_content: Location information – we collect and process general information about the location of the device from which you are accessing the Service (e.g., approximate geographic location inferred from an IP address).
privacy_policy_settings.workspace_use_metadata_content: Workspace Use Metadata – when you interact with the Service, metadata is generated that provides high-level (non-content) information about the way you work in your Workspace. For example, we may log the number of Workspaces you work in; the number of tasks to which you are assigned; the features and embedded Service content you interact with; the types of files you share; and what, if any, third-party services and integrations you use.
privacy_policy_settings.other_information_content: Other Information. You may provide us with information when you interact with us in other ways, such as when you submit requests or questions to us via forms or email (e.g., support forms, sales forms, user research participation forms); information you provide in connection with
privacy_policy_settings.sweepstakes_contests: sweepstakes, contests, or research studies in which you choose to participate; beta testing; and requests for customer support and technical assistance (collectively, “Other Information”).
privacy_policy_settings.third_party_integrations: Information Collected from Third-Party Integrations. If you choose to use or connect to third-party integrations (e.g., OneDrive,
privacy_policy_settings.slack_through_the_service: , Slack) through the Service, or if you are required or permitted to do so by a Customer, such third parties may allow us to have access to and store additional information about your interaction with those services as it relates to your use of the Service. If you initiate these connections, you also understand that we will share information about you that is required to enable your use of the third-party integration through the Service. If you do not wish to have this information shared, do not initiate these connections. By enabling these connections, you authorize us to connect and access the information provided through these connections, and you understand that the privacy policies of these third parties govern such connections.
privacy_policy_settings.may_view_and: may view and use Workspace Content collected from and about Subscribers only as necessary:

workspace_content_bullet_points.to_maintain: To maintain, provide, and improve the Service
workspace_content_bullet_points.to_prevent: To prevent or address technical or security issues and resolve support requests
workspace_content_bullet_points.to_investigate: To investigate when there is a good faith belief or complaint alleging violation of the Customer Agreement or User Terms of Service
workspace_content_bullet_points.to_comply_with: To comply with a valid legal subpoena, request, or other lawful process

privacy_policy_settings.sweepstakes_contest: sweepstakes, contest, or research study offered through the Websites, we will also collect basic contact information from you in connection with such activity.
privacy_policy_settings.website_usage: Websites Usage Information – as you browse the Websites, we and our service providers (which are third party companies that work on our behalf to provide and enhance the Websites) use a variety of technologies, including cookies and similar tools, to assist in collecting information about how you use the Websites. For example, our servers automatically record certain information in server logs. These server logs may include information such as your web request, IP address, browser type and settings, referring / exit pages and URLs, number of clicks and how you interact with links on the Websites, domain names, landing pages, pages viewed, mobile carrier, mobile device identifiers and information about the device you are using to access the Websites, date and time stamp information and other such information.
privacy_policy_settings.location_info: Location Information – We collect and process general information about the location of the device from which you are accessing the Service (e.g., approximate geographic location inferred from an IP address).
privacy_policy_settings.to_collect_the: To collect the Websites Usage Information discussed above, we and our service providers use Internet server logs, cookies, tags, SDKs, tracking pixels, and other similar tracking technologies. A web server log is a file where website activity is stored. An SDK is a section of code that we embed in our applications and software to allow third parties to collect information about how users interact with the Websites. A cookie is a small text file that is placed on your computer or mobile device when you visit a site, that enables us to: (
privacy_policy_settings.recognize_your: ) recognize your computer and login session; (ii) store your preferences and settings; (iii) understand which pages of the Websites you have visited; (iv), enhance your user experience by delivering and measuring the effectiveness of content and advertising tailored to your interests; (v) perform analytics; and (vi) assist with security and administrative functions. Tracking pixels (sometimes referred to as web beacons or clear GIFs) are tiny electronic tags with a unique identifier embedded in websites, online ads and/or email, and that are designed to provide usage information like ad impressions or clicks, email open rates, measure popularity of the Websites and associated advertising, and to access user cookies. As we adopt additional technologies, we may also gather information through other methods. Please note that you can change your settings to notify you when a cookie is being set or updated, or to block cookies altogether. Please consult the “Help” section of your browser for more information (e.g., Internet Explorer; Google Chrome; Mozilla Firefox; or Apple Safari).

publish_test_strings.title: Publish for Testing

content.answer_1: Test mode lets you publish your flows for testing. Only a selected few people can access these flows under test mode. Once you feel like you are done testing the flow you can publish the flow for live to be accessed by everyone in Workhall.
content.answer_2: When you publish something on test mode, it is available for only a selected few to view. These flows, and the task associated with them will be available in the dashboard along with all other flows/ tasks. To switch off test mode, open the particular flow. There will be an option called 'Publish for live' in the top-right corner. Clicking this will switch off the test mode and publish the flow. It can be switched back on at any time - even after publishing.

mfa.description: Secure your account with Time-Based One Time Password (TOTP) or Email-Based One Time Password (EOTP) Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA).
mfa.totp_description: Secure your account with Time-Based One Time Password (TOTP) Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA).

mfa_popover_strings.user_enable_disable_success_subtitle: Email is send to your mail id

mfa.mfa_tooltip_content: Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA) serves as a robust security enhancement, mandating users to provide two or more distinct authentication factors before obtaining access to their workhall account or sensitive information. The integration of MFA significantly fortifies the security of our application, creating a formidable defense against diverse forms of unauthorized access, such as password breaches, phishing attacks, and credential stuffing. MFA is widely used in various applications, including online banking, email services, and corporate networks, to help prevent unauthorized access and protect sensitive information. Instead of relying solely on the conventional method of authentication like email/username and password, it is advisable to incorporate an additional layer of security through MFA.
